description: Enhanced horror lexicon for dynamically generating rich, thematically consistent horror writing across all ScaryGamesAI content. Expanded for Phase 1 with 7 core horror themes.

folk: the bass drone of didgeridoo heat

confined: allow no space between body and surface

sound: whispered at the edge of hearing

starting: a whisper at the edge of hearing
culmination: screaming that fills the world volume of my skull
subliminal frequencies beyond hearing that make the teeth vibrate
a sound that bypasses the ears and goes straight to the brain
the sound of something that shouldn't be able to make sound

liminal: a tone that makes the eyes water
cosmic: a sound that seems to come from everywhere at once
gore: the sound of something being crushed

inward_addressing.description: Subliminal command forms for internal monologues that feel audible without sound
examples: You have formed them before: shapes without model. They circle, agitated, waiting to become solid.
They taught you the name. Don't say it. Don't even think it in the thoughts they gifted you.
I must not understand. Understanding means I've been dust for days.
The walls are breathing. Or maybe that's just the blood in your ears.
You've seen this pattern before. In the asylum. In the backrooms. In your dreams.

fragmentary_damage.description: Narrative fragments that feel physically damaged - torn, smudged, distorted

character_dialog.description: Dialogue patterns for characters in horror contexts

doubt: Did you {action} or did I imagine it?
I could have sworn {observation}, but now {contradiction}.
denial: There must be a rational explanation. {desperate_attempt}.

psychological_horror.name: Psychological Horror
psychological_horror.description: The fear of losing one's mind, unreality, mind control, gaslighting

cosmic_horror.name: Cosmic Horror
cosmic_horror.description: Fear of realizing humanity's insignificance, villainous god, inhuman patrons

never_use_personification: The void doesn't hate you. It doesn't even know you exist.
Never say 'ancient ones look upon'. They do not 'look' in any way a human understands the operation of looking.
Never speak of 'spells'. Those are merely arbitrary invoked actual physical regularities.

gore.name: Gore Horror
gore.description: Extreme violence, visceral horror, body horror, graphic descriptions

never_soften_impact: Never use euphemisms for bodily harm. If something is severed, say it is severed.
Never imply violence - describe it in visceral detail.
Never sanitize the aftermath. Blood doesn't 'pool' - it 'congeals in thick, glistening clots'.

supernatural.name: Supernatural Horror
supernatural.description: Ghosts, hauntings, curses, possession, the unseen world, ancient evils

never_explain_the_supernatural: Never provide definitive explanations for supernatural events. Leave room for doubt.
Never confirm the nature of supernatural entities. Let them remain ambiguous.
Never resolve supernatural mysteries. Let them linger and fester.

post_apocalyptic.name: Post-Apocalyptic Horror
post_apocalyptic.description: Survival in a ruined world, the collapse of civilization, scavenging in the wasteland

never_glorify_the_apocalypse: Never romanticize the end of the world. Show the suffering, the loss, the desperation.
Never make survival look easy. Every resource should be hard-won.
Never sanitize the aftermath. Show the decay, the rot, the failure of systems.

fantasy.name: Fantasy Horror
fantasy.description: Dark fantasy, cursed magic, ancient curses, forbidden knowledge

never_cheapen_magic: Never make magic look easy or without consequence. Every spell should have a cost.
Never explain magic completely. Some mysteries should remain.
Never make ancient evils defeatable by simple means. They should require sacrifice.

sci_fi.name: Sci-Fi Horror
sci_fi.description: Cosmic horror meets technology, AI gone wrong, alien abductions

never_anthropomorphize_ai: Never give AI human emotions or motivations. It's a machine, not a person.
Never make AI defeatable by human logic or emotion. It operates on different principles.
Never make technological horror explainable by simple means. The terror should be in the unknown.

Patient records describe treatments that never existed, performed by doctors who were never born. The {nouns_from.occult} in the margins suggest {forbidden_knowledge}.

descriptions.pristine: Reality is stable. Your mind is clear. Everything makes sense.
descriptions.normal: You feel grounded. Minor inconsistencies don't bother you.
descriptions.disturbed: Small anomalies catch your attention. Doubt creeps in.
descriptions.paranoid: Everything seems suspicious. Patterns emerge where none should exist.
descriptions.psychotic: Reality fractures. Your mind creates explanations for the inexplicable.

descriptions.stable: The world behaves as expected. No supernatural phenomena detected.
descriptions.uncertain: Minor anomalies suggest something is not quite right.
descriptions.compromised: Reality flickers at the edges. Supernatural events occur regularly.
descriptions.collapsing: The laws of physics no longer apply consistently. The supernatural dominates.

descriptions.abundant: Resources are plentiful. Survival is relatively easy.
descriptions.adequate: Supplies are sufficient but require management.
descriptions.scarce: Every resource must be carefully rationed. Survival is challenging.
descriptions.critical: Essential resources are nearly exhausted. Desperation sets in.

descriptions.none: Your connection to magic is pure. No corruption detected.
descriptions.minor: Subtle changes suggest magic is affecting you.
descriptions.moderate: Visible signs of magical corruption appear.
descriptions.severe: Magic has fundamentally altered your being. The changes are irreversible.

descriptions.stable: The laws of physics operate normally. No anomalies detected.
